result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher F McFadden

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher F McFadden in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by defendant, denied. Court to appoint an attorney, repayment at zero. May re-argue bond motion at next hearing before Judge Koss. Court extends WRIT. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher F McFadden not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in Racine Co. Jail, to be brought on writ. Record as to Attorney Jude's representation - motion to withdraw. State request pro se motion be sealed. Court seals pro se bond motion. Minutes filed.

Pro se motion to modify bond
The original document was titled: Pro se motion to modify bond
The original history event date is: 10-04-2022
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Christopher F McFadden appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to withdraw filed by Attorney. Defendant states attorney not pursuing. Clerk to set up attorney to set up date. Minutes filed.

Defendant Christopher F McFadden in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Michael Jude not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court tried to call attorney, went straight to voicemail, unable to leave voicemail. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
